title: Illithanachronounbinder
data:
The **Illithanachronounbinder** (or **Acu** for short) is a role that appears in [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). They are based on [Anachrononauts](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") and [Binders](/wiki/Binder "Binder"), and act as their opposite number as implied by the role's name.

Illithanachronounbinders can be any of the following races: [humans](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [orcs](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)"), [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(starting_race\) "Dwarf (starting race)"), [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)"), [gnomes](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)"), [half-dragons](/wiki/Half-dragon_\(starting_race\) "Half-dragon (starting race)"), [incantifiers](/wiki/Incantifier_\(starting_race\) "Incantifier (starting race)"), [ents](/index.php?title=Ent_\(starting_race\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ent (starting race) (page does not exist)"), [salamanders](/index.php?title=Salamander_\(starting_race\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Salamander (starting race) (page does not exist)"), or [yuki-onna](/wiki/Yuki-onna_\(starting_race\) "Yuki-onna (starting race)").

An Illithanachronounbinder is always lawful and cannot change [alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment"); they are also considered a [mind flayer](/wiki/Illithid_\(starting_race\) "Illithid (starting race)") of the selected starting race, possessing all of that race's abilities alongside those of mind flayers.

**Below this point are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.**

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Etymology](#Etymology)
- [2 Starting inventory](#Starting_inventory)
- [3 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [4 Skills](#Skills)
- [5 Special rules](#Special_rules)
  - [5.1 Spirits](#Spirits)
- [6 Quest](#Quest)
- [7 Gods](#Gods)
- [8 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [9 Strategy](#Strategy)

## Etymology

The components of the name "Illith-anachrono-un-binder" describe what the role is and does:

- **Illith** refers to illithids, another name for [mind flayers](/wiki/Illithid_\(starting_race\) "Illithid (starting race)"). That is what an Acu character is: a mind flayer that has taken over the body of a monster from the selected starting race.

- **anachrono** refers to Anachrononauts, whose mission is to go back in time and eject the mind flayer goddess Ilsensine from the universe, to change history and stop her from conquering the universe in the future.

- **[binder](/wiki/Binder "Binder")** is a role that summons [spirits](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") and gains power from them by binding them to their soul.

- **un** is a prefix that means "not" or "opposite", and in this context it refers to the Illithanachronounbinder's goals:

  - They are trying to undo what the Anachrononaut achieved and save their goddess Ilsensine.
  - They also summon Binder spirits, but unlike Binders who work with their spirits, Illithanachronounbinders must battle and kill the spirits' physical incarnations in order to grow stronger.

The Illithanachronounbinder was originally going to be called the **Anachronounbinder**, but the letters a and A were already taken in the role selection menu (for [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") and Anachrononaut).

## Starting inventory

- a +3 [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")
- a +0 [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- a +1 [leather armour](/wiki/Leather_armour "Leather armour")
- a +0 [leather helm](/index.php?title=Leather_helm_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Leather helm (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
- a pair of [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves")
- 3 [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")
- a [R'lyehian faceplate](/index.php?title=R%27lyehian_faceplate\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "R'lyehian faceplate (page does not exist)")
- a [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") (unless a [drow](/wiki/Drow "Drow"))
- a pair of [high boots](/wiki/High_boots "High boots") (unless [slithy](/wiki/Slithy "Slithy") or not [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid"))

## Intrinsics

All Illithanachronounbinders gain these intrinsics at the following [experience levels](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1: [ESP](/wiki/ESP "ESP"), tentacle attack, mind blast ability

  - The tentacle attack automatically triggers in melee, giving nutrition to the user if the target has a brain; you cannot choke or vomit obtaining nutrition this way. The attack can also kill the target by [brainlessness](/wiki/Brainlessness "Brainlessness").
  - The mind blast works identically to the [Madperson ability](/wiki/Madman#Psychic_powers "Madman"), but is stronger due to the player being a mind flayer.

- XL 4: Psionic pulse ability: a directional psionic attack which deals damage and is able to knock monsters back.

- XL 7: Psionic echolocation: works identically to the [chiropteran](/wiki/Chiropteran "Chiropteran") echolocation ability.

- XL 10: [Flying](/wiki/Flying "Flying")

- XL 12: Psionic craze ability: allows you to "psionically torture" a monster, which may make it flee.

- XL 14: [Reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection")

- XL 15: [Telekinesis](/wiki/Telekinesis "Telekinesis"): allows picking up items from a distance.

- XL 17: [Teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control")

- XL 20: All thrown items return

## Skills

| Illithanachronounbinder skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| Max                            | [Skills](/wiki/Skill "Skill")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| Basic                          | - *Weapons:* [lance](/wiki/Lance "Lance"), [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")
- *Spells*: [attack](/wiki/Attack "Attack"), [healing](/wiki/Healing "Healing"), [matter](/wiki/Matter "Matter")
- *Combat:* [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") |
| Skilled                        | * *Weapons:* [two-handed sword](/wiki/Two-handed_sword "Two-handed sword"), [whip](/wiki/Whip "Whip"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber"), [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword")
* *Spells*: [divination](/wiki/Divination "Divination")                                                                                                                           |
| Expert                         | - *Weapons:* [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")
- *Combat:* [shii-cho](/wiki/Lightsaber_Forms_\(dNetHack\)#Form_I:_Shii-Cho "Lightsaber Forms (dNetHack)"), [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")                                                                                                                           |

## Special rules

Illithanachronounbinders are immune to [madness](/wiki/Madness "Madness"), and their [sanity](/wiki/Sanity "Sanity") is always locked at 100.

Illithanachronounbinders cannot level up normally, and must summon [spirits](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") in order to gain experience levels.

### Spirits

- *Main article: [Spirits (dNetHack)](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)")*

For Illithanachronounbinders, spirits function similarly to Binders, though with a twist: once summoned, they will also appear as hostile monsters.

Illithanachronounbinders begin with knowledge of Ahazu's and Amon's seals, and can only learn most of the other seals by gaining levels - the seals are unlocked in in vaguely alphabetical order. Summoning a spirit is enough to be able to gain an experience level: while killing the spirit is not required, they can drop often-useful items that make it worthwhile.

| Spirit seal                                                                                                  | XL learned | Reward(s)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

| [Ahazu](/wiki/Ahazu "Ahazu")                                                                                 | 1          | 4-5 [food rations](/wiki/Food_ration "Food ration")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| [Amon](/wiki/Amon "Amon")                                                                                    | 1          | [frost horn](/wiki/Frost_horn "Frost horn") with a high chance of a non-standard material (e.g. [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") or [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril")).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

## Quest

- *Main article: [Illithanachronounbinder quest](/index.php?title=Illithanachronounbinder_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Illithanachronounbinder quest (page does not exist)")*

The Illithanachronounbinder quest sees you fighting the [alhoon](/wiki/Alhoon "Alhoon") [Menzoberranzan](/index.php?title=Menzoberranzan\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Menzoberranzan (page does not exist)") for the [Elder Cerebral Fluid](/index.php?title=Elder_Cerebral_Fluid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Elder Cerebral Fluid (page does not exist)"), a [dilithium crystal](/wiki/Dilithium_crystal "Dilithium crystal") which confers [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage") and [energy regeneration](/wiki/Energy_regeneration "Energy regeneration") while carried.

The quest contains many hostile mind flayers ("adversaries") and so-called [villithids](/wiki/Villithid "Villithid"), which are vampire mind flayers that can drain your levels in addition to sucking your brain.

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

* Lawful: [Ilsensine](/wiki/Ilsensine "Ilsensine")
* Neutral: [Resistance](/index.php?title=Resistance_\(god\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Resistance (god) (page does not exist)")
* Chaotic: [Thoon](/index.php?title=Thoon\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Thoon (page does not exist)")

Due to their god Ilsensine being fallen, praying and sacrificing is impossible for Illithanachronounbinders, though [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude")-testing on [altars](/wiki/Altar "Altar") still works as usual.

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

- XL 1–2: Exorcist
- XL 3–5: Unbinder
- XL 6–9: Vestige Vanquisher
- XL 10–13: Spirit Killer
- XL 14–17: Mind Flayer
- XL 18–21: Psionaut
- XL 22–25: Void Voider
- XL 26–29: Telekinetic
- XL 30: Keeper of the Gate

## Strategy

Illithanachronounbinders must fight many mini-bosses to advance, with the rewards further encouraging you to vanquish them. Fighting some of the spirits will be tough - however, unless specifically mentioned, they are all vulnerable to your brain eating attack.

- Ahazu:
  - He has threatening melee attacks, including Famine's touch and can digest you. Use ranged attacks.
- Amon:
  - Very early tough fight. He will hit fast and hard. Due to his high speed and thick hide, it is usually required to draw the seal, escape downstairs, get some equipment and gain a level and then come back. Drops a frost horn you will likely need for Balam's seal.
- Andrealphus:
  - Very fast but not nearly as threatening as the previous two. Can teleport you around with his attacks.
- Andromalius:
  - Will use the stack of daggers he is guaranteed to spawn with, so be prepared for some ranged attacks. He can both paralyze you and teleport your equipped gear away, which is especially dangerous in combination with the paralysis he inflicts. Ranged attacks are strongly recommended.
- Astaroth:
  - Will create automatons such as clockwork dwarves to fight for him. Can hit hard in melee but it is managable.
- Balam:
  - Another tough fight. She is fast and will use a ranged icy gaze at you and a cold touch attack in melee. Beware of her demon gating abilities.
- Berith:
  - Due to the artifact helm he will be dropping, he is invulnerable to your brain eating attacks. He hits hard and fast in melee and deals more damage to creatures with blood, so basically all races except Etherealoids, Ents, and Clockwork Automata. He also has an AC of 0.
- Buer:
  - Beware his poisonous bite and speed. He is fortunately rather unremarkable and binding him will permanently unlock martial arts for you.
- Chupoclops:
  - Would be dangerous if the binding did not confer immunity to webs and movement speed penalties to nearby monsters. Beware her poisonous bite. The many spider eggs she drops will hatch and spawn an army of cave spiders. They are not too dangerous, but they will be annoying.
- Dantalion:
  - Hits hard in melee and will teleport to the upstairs like some of the demon lords. He will wear armor and will thus be resistant to brain eating attacks.
- Shiro:
  - Very hard to hit and will retaliate by throwing rocks as a bonus attack. Vulnerable to brain eating attacks, but they will rarely land due to his high AC. Annoying to fight but not too dangerous.
- Echidna:
  - Beware her seducing attacks. Her acid breath is also pretty nasty, but can be countered with reflection.
- Eden:
  - Basically a silver dragon with a fire breath attack, much higher MR and less damaging physical attacks.
- Enki:
  - Will use water-based attacks to try and apply water damage to your inventory and equipped weapon.
- Eurynome:
  - Mediocre damage output compared to what you've faced by now, but can levelport in melee and steal items as a nymph. Use ranged attacks to prevent tedium and YASD.
- Eve:
  - Moderate damage, speed, and AC, but fires 1-4 iron arrows per attack.
- Fafnir:
  - Higher health and damage than Eve, but only has a poison breath for ranged damage. Not especially dangerous.
- Huginn and Muninn:
  - You'll be facing two flying enemies with stunning and stat draining attacks. Make sure to have high damage or attack from range.
- Iris:
  - Possesses a sickness and hallucination inducing attack. Slightly above normal speed.
- Jack:
  - Hits weaker than a gnome, but the 100d4 fiery explosion on death may complicate melee strategies. Resurrects as a rider. With careful planning and positioning (and preferably, fire resistance), could serve as a makeshift bomb against high health monsters not resistant to fire.

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Illithanachronounbinder

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Illithanachronounbinder (or Acu for short) is a role that appears in notdNetHack. They are based on Anachrononauts and Binders, and act as their opposite number as implied by the role's name.

Illithanachronounbinders can be any of the following races: humans, orcs, dwarves, elves, drow, gnomes, half-dragons, incantifiers, ents, salamanders, or yuki-onna.

An Illithanachronounbinder is always lawful and cannot change alignment; they are also considered a mind flayer of the selected starting race, possessing all of that race's abilities alongside those of mind flayers.

Below this point are major spoilers for the Illithanachronounbinder role.

Contents

  • 1 Etymology
  • 2 Starting inventory
  • 3 Intrinsics
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Special rules
    • 5.1 Spirits
  • 6 Quest
  • 7 Gods
  • 8 Rank titles
  • 9 Strategy

Etymology

The components of the name "Illith-anachrono-un-binder" describe what the role is and does:

  • Illith refers to illithids, another name for mind flayers. That is what an Acu character is: a mind flayer that has taken over the body of a monster from the selected starting race.
  • anachrono refers to Anachrononauts, whose mission is to go back in time and eject the mind flayer goddess Ilsensine from the universe, to change history and stop her from conquering the universe in the future.
  • binder is a role that summons spirits and gains power from them by binding them to their soul.
  • un is a prefix that means "not" or "opposite", and in this context it refers to the Illithanachronounbinder's goals:
    • They are trying to undo what the Anachrononaut achieved and save their goddess Ilsensine.
    • They also summon Binder spirits, but unlike Binders who work with their spirits, Illithanachronounbinders must battle and kill the spirits' physical incarnations in order to grow stronger.

The Illithanachronounbinder was originally going to be called the Anachronounbinder, but the letters a and A were already taken in the role selection menu (for Archeologist and Anachrononaut).

Starting inventory

  • a +3 quarterstaff
  • a +0 dagger
  • a +1 leather armour
  • a +0 leather helm
  • a pair of gloves
  • 3 food rations
  • a R'lyehian faceplate
  • a robe (unless a drow)
  • a pair of high boots (unless slithy or not humanoid)

Intrinsics

All Illithanachronounbinders gain these intrinsics at the following experience levels:

  • XL 1: ESP, tentacle attack, mind blast ability
    • The tentacle attack automatically triggers in melee, giving nutrition to the user if the target has a brain; you cannot choke or vomit obtaining nutrition this way. The attack can also kill the target by brainlessness.
    • The mind blast works identically to the Madperson ability, but is stronger due to the player being a mind flayer.
  • XL 4: Psionic pulse ability: a directional psionic attack which deals damage and is able to knock monsters back.
  • XL 7: Psionic echolocation: works identically to the chiropteran echolocation ability.
  • XL 10: Flying
  • XL 12: Psionic craze ability: allows you to "psionically torture" a monster, which may make it flee.
  • XL 14: Reflection
  • XL 15: Telekinesis: allows picking up items from a distance.
  • XL 17: Teleport control
  • XL 20: All thrown items return

Skills

Illithanachronounbinder skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: lance, long sword, hammer, dart, pick-axe, boomerang, spear
  • Spells: attack, healing, matter
  • Combat: riding
Skilled
  • Weapons: two-handed sword, whip, club, saber, knife, short sword
  • Spells: divination
Expert
  • Weapons: quarterstaff, broadsword, dagger
  • Combat: shii-cho, bare hands

Special rules

Illithanachronounbinders are immune to madness, and their sanity is always locked at 100.

Illithanachronounbinders cannot level up normally, and must summon spirits in order to gain experience levels.

Spirits

Main article: Spirits (dNetHack)

For Illithanachronounbinders, spirits function similarly to Binders, though with a twist: once summoned, they will also appear as hostile monsters.

Illithanachronounbinders begin with knowledge of Ahazu's and Amon's seals, and can only learn most of the other seals by gaining levels - the seals are unlocked in in vaguely alphabetical order. Summoning a spirit is enough to be able to gain an experience level: while killing the spirit is not required, they can drop often-useful items that make it worthwhile.

  • +10 Plates of the Near Void

Quest

Main article: Illithanachronounbinder quest

The Illithanachronounbinder quest sees you fighting the alhoon Menzoberranzan for the Elder Cerebral Fluid, a dilithium crystal which confers half spell damage and energy regeneration while carried.

The quest contains many hostile mind flayers ("adversaries") and so-called villithids, which are vampire mind flayers that can drain your levels in addition to sucking your brain.

Gods

Main article: Religion
  • Lawful: Ilsensine
  • Neutral: Resistance
  • Chaotic: Thoon

Due to their god Ilsensine being fallen, praying and sacrificing is impossible for Illithanachronounbinders, though beatitude-testing on altars still works as usual.

Rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1–2: Exorcist
  • XL 3–5: Unbinder
  • XL 6–9: Vestige Vanquisher
  • XL 10–13: Spirit Killer
  • XL 14–17: Mind Flayer
  • XL 18–21: Psionaut
  • XL 22–25: Void Voider
  • XL 26–29: Telekinetic
  • XL 30: Keeper of the Gate

Strategy

Illithanachronounbinders must fight many mini-bosses to advance, with the rewards further encouraging you to vanquish them. Fighting some of the spirits will be tough - however, unless specifically mentioned, they are all vulnerable to your brain eating attack.

  • Ahazu:
    • He has threatening melee attacks, including Famine's touch and can digest you. Use ranged attacks.
  • Amon:
    • Very early tough fight. He will hit fast and hard. Due to his high speed and thick hide, it is usually required to draw the seal, escape downstairs, get some equipment and gain a level and then come back. Drops a frost horn you will likely need for Balam's seal.
  • Andrealphus:
    • Very fast but not nearly as threatening as the previous two. Can teleport you around with his attacks.
  • Andromalius:
    • Will use the stack of daggers he is guaranteed to spawn with, so be prepared for some ranged attacks. He can both paralyze you and teleport your equipped gear away, which is especially dangerous in combination with the paralysis he inflicts. Ranged attacks are strongly recommended.
  • Astaroth:
    • Will create automatons such as clockwork dwarves to fight for him. Can hit hard in melee but it is managable.
  • Balam:
    • Another tough fight. She is fast and will use a ranged icy gaze at you and a cold touch attack in melee. Beware of her demon gating abilities.
  • Berith:
    • Due to the artifact helm he will be dropping, he is invulnerable to your brain eating attacks. He hits hard and fast in melee and deals more damage to creatures with blood, so basically all races except Etherealoids, Ents, and Clockwork Automata. He also has an AC of 0.
  • Buer:
    • Beware his poisonous bite and speed. He is fortunately rather unremarkable and binding him will permanently unlock martial arts for you.
  • Chupoclops:
    • Would be dangerous if the binding did not confer immunity to webs and movement speed penalties to nearby monsters. Beware her poisonous bite. The many spider eggs she drops will hatch and spawn an army of cave spiders. They are not too dangerous, but they will be annoying.
  • Dantalion:
    • Hits hard in melee and will teleport to the upstairs like some of the demon lords. He will wear armor and will thus be resistant to brain eating attacks.
  • Shiro:
    • Very hard to hit and will retaliate by throwing rocks as a bonus attack. Vulnerable to brain eating attacks, but they will rarely land due to his high AC. Annoying to fight but not too dangerous.
  • Echidna:
    • Beware her seducing attacks. Her acid breath is also pretty nasty, but can be countered with reflection.
  • Eden:
    • Basically a silver dragon with a fire breath attack, much higher MR and less damaging physical attacks.
  • Enki:
    • Will use water-based attacks to try and apply water damage to your inventory and equipped weapon.
  • Eurynome:
    • Mediocre damage output compared to what you've faced by now, but can levelport in melee and steal items as a nymph. Use ranged attacks to prevent tedium and YASD.
  • Eve:
    • Moderate damage, speed, and AC, but fires 1-4 iron arrows per attack.
  • Fafnir:
    • Higher health and damage than Eve, but only has a poison breath for ranged damage. Not especially dangerous.
  • Huginn and Muninn:
    • You'll be facing two flying enemies with stunning and stat draining attacks. Make sure to have high damage or attack from range.
  • Iris:
    • Possesses a sickness and hallucination inducing attack. Slightly above normal speed.
  • Jack:
    • Hits weaker than a gnome, but the 100d4 fiery explosion on death may complicate melee strategies. Resurrects as a rider. With careful planning and positioning (and preferably, fire resistance), could serve as a makeshift bomb against high health monsters not resistant to fire.
